message: Starting resource lifecycle investigation - reading real_mcp_server.py to analyze tmux session management and cleanup mechanisms
Analyzing deploy_headless_agent and kill_real_agent functions - found tmux session creation and cleanup mechanisms
Analyzing get_agent_output to check if it monitors session lifecycle and handles cleanup
Checking if there are any zombie processes or orphaned sessions currently in the system
Creating comprehensive resource lifecycle analysis report with all findings and recommendations

Investigation complete. Delivered comprehensive RESOURCE_LIFECYCLE_ANALYSIS.md report with 10 sections covering: resource creation flow, current cleanup mechanisms, identified leaks (5 categories), root cause analysis, 3 implementation options, testing plan, and monitoring metrics. Key finding: CRITICAL resource leaks in tmux sessions, JSONL file handles, and temporary files. Recommended hybrid solution with immediate cleanup + safety daemon. Evidence: 78 prompt files, 38 logs, 4 tmux sessions, 54 processes accumulated.
